Articles.Content:
Whenever I play KSP, I've always wanted to have filters to make it seem more realistic/nostalgic.

Filters like:

Frame corner bending (which would bend the edges of the screen to make it seem like you're looking through a camera lens)

Static (for nostalgic space race era launches)

Shutter snaps (this could be used if drones or rovers ever get cameras, when you switch to and from 1st person, the shutter snaps open or closed)

dimming (when your drone is running out of power, the camera dims)

optional focus distance bar (self explanatory)

I think this would be more fit as a mod, since these are visual "instagram" options that add nothing to the game.

None of these filters seems to involve a peculiar missions status, nor any useful infos for the player, except for the dimming, which IMO is an interesting feature, as it tells something (lack of power) without the need to look at numbers.

Frame bending woulg be cool if it was a way to tell the G you are taking in IVA. (until there is so much G there is a bit of a blackout).

So, I'd say yes, much support for your idea, as long as they are IVA features. Such features in "3rd person" would be quirky as Kerb.
